intro: Rhipidoglossum leedalii, commonly known as the Leedal's beard lichen, is a saxicolous lichen belonging to the family Parmeliaceae. It is characterized by its foliose thallus, which is typically pale green to yellowish in color. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship with algae, which provides the necessary photosynthetic function. It is often found growing on rock surfaces in temperate and subarctic regions. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
